notes: Bar a Joe, in Swedish.

24.heading: Le Bar à Joe--Articles About.
24.title: "La Question du Réalisme dans Le Bar à Joe"
24.author: Jean-Philippe Martin
24.appears_in: p. 38-45 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 3 (Jan. 1998).
notes: (Muñoz et Sampayo)

Begins: "Outre ses positionnements idéologiques, ses profondes qualités humaines, Le Bar à Joe, ouvrage difficile aux images labiles, plus encore que de s'employer à mimer la surface du réel, en restaure la partie la plus difficile à saisir. Une oeuvre dont le réalisme s'impose comme un véritable enjeu artistique."

English summary (from p. 138): "Realism in Le Bar à Joe. Le Bar à Joe (Joe's Bar), a rendezvous where thousands of destinies interweave, gave Muñoz and Sampayo the idea for a series of stories that departs from the conventions of narrative in vogue in comics in an attempt to convey the depth of real life. Jean-Philippe Martin examines the narrative disorder which appears to be rampant in these stories, the great abundance of visual information, the status of the spoken word, and the way in which elements of reality find their way into this fiction."
Includes bibliographical references.

128.title: Barbarella
128.author: von Jean-Claude Forest ; übersetzt von Joe Hembus.
notes: Genres: Science fiction, erotic.

129.title: "Barbarella"
129.author: by Jean-Claude Forest
notes: Introduction and first 8 pages. Printed in black and green.

Summary: Barbarella is captured by the locksmith, and released to disturb the queen's dreams. The queen gives her a tour of Sogo, and shows her a poison-spewing monster and the winged prisoner Pygar. Barbarella frees Pygar and they escape in a vehicle called a desiderobus, with the queen as hostage.

130.title: "Barbarella
130.author: by Jean-Claude Forest
notes: Introduction summarizing previous events, and 8 new pages. Printed in black and purple.

Summary: Barbarella crashes the desiderobus in a labyrinth, where Duran tries to help her. The queen escapes and someone orders the beast to release its venom, flooding the labyrinth. Gronf II, the caretaker, has usurped the throne. Barbarella and the queen, with Pygar, escape in an argobarque, which crashes. Pygar regains enough strength to fly them away from the crash.

131.title: "Barbarella
131.author: by Jean-Claude Forest
notes: Introduction summarizing previous events, and 10 new pages. Printed in black and green.
Summary: Barbarella crashes in a greenhouse on Lythion, and into a war between Crystallia and the Orhomrs.

142.heading: Barbarella--Miscellanea.
142.title: "Un Demi-Siècle d'Interdictions de Bandes Dessinées"
142.author: Bernard Joubert
142.appears_in: p. 28-33 in 9e art : Les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 4 (Jan. 1999).
notes: (49-956 ou la Démoralisation de la Jeunesse : les 50 Ans de la Loi du 16 Juillet 1949)

Begins: "Il y a vingt ans, des éditeurs tels que Casterman, le Square, Dargaud ou les Humanoïdes Associés s'écriaient à Angoulême 'À bas la censure hypocrite!', réclamant la suppression de l'article 14. Comment cet article, toujours en vigeur, de la loi de 1949, a-t-il été appliqué à la bande dessinée?"

English summary (from page 142): "Half a Century of Banned Comics. Bernard Joubert is a specialist on censorship. He gives us an overview of half a century of application of the law of 49, recalling the most memorable bans. Barbarella and Hara-Kiri in the sixties, for example. More recently the Japanese mangas have been in the censors' line of fire."
Includes illustrations and bibliographical references.
